name: One&Only Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very comfortable stay in our island suite.
reviews.title: Good stay, I'm sure the will sort out the one problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were many positives, many of which have been covered well in other reviews. Excellent location. Staff keen to serve and rooms furnished high standard. I agree with them all.
reviews.title: Lives up to its name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The island rooms are not quite as isolated as the name might suggest, and there are some minor privacy compromises. The rooms near the pool are convenient but suffer some noise from late night revellers. The advantages out weight the disadvantages for me, it is hard to beat sitting on your balcony overlooking water having a drink after the sun passes over the yard arm.
reviews.title: Breakfast at Rueben's

reviews.text: Rubens is a standard international hotel restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. That's a little unfair, it does both jobs well and stands comparison with cafes in excellent hotels the world over. Nothing special though.
reviews.title: Grand and Polished, Something for Everyone

reviews.text: Nobu is a good Japanese restaurant. In some ways that is a little surprising because of the stellar Nobu brand name. It does not quite reach the heights of the other Nobu family restaurants I have visited, but is a lively and well priced destination restaurant.
reviews.title: South African Hospitality at its Best

reviews.text: We took a group of managers here (total 13). From the start when we arrived, we were looked after and treated like VIP's. Well located right next to the water front and views of table mountain to die for. Nobu restaurant is a must if you are into sushi! The best we have had (besides in Japan, but how can anyone compete?) My wife said she had the oysters and that these were the best she had ever had. Breakfast in the morning was superb and coming down and being greeted by the staff and making you feel extra special just made the whole trip a top stay! Our room was superb and so where those of our managers. Everyone raved about how great the hotel was and kept on asking us why we left South Africa to move to Sweden. So a good place to stay. Vista lounge with high tea in the afternoon was also a every day must. The only complaint? They ran out of brandy, which sure, with 13 people drinking the same brandy could maybe be expected that they would run low, but I did not expect this from a hotel of this standard to actually run out, but generally all round it was excellent and maybe we were drinking too much as we were enjoying ourselves too much?
reviews.title: The name says it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Only and Only in Cape Town, and it is must. Wonderful hotel, excellent accommodation, really good food, and the staff are very helpful. Right next to a beautiful marina, and close to all the shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: On & Only Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location near/on the Waterfront, yet very quiet rooms (we had a Table Mountain facing room in the main building). Stayed for 4 nights. The overall service was really very good, with exceptional friendly and efficient concierge assistance from Linda and a wonderful Chris Noone (his Cape Town restaurant recommendations are spot on ... see separate reviews). Only remark about the rooms is the rather complex way to operate the TV but hey, that's just detail. We had breakfast daily at Rueben's, and it was sumpteous and of excellent quality, with friendly service at all times. Wonderful pool and pool area, although it tends to get a bit overcrowded, with the usual mess of left/dropprd towels , though staff tries hard to clean-up after guests. Wonderful gym ... one of the best hotel gyms I have ever come accross anywhere. We did not use the Spa. Oddly enough (and as remarked elsewhere), hotel security is at the same time inexistant as entry from the rear is wide open e.g. via the waterway boat tour landing platform and quite tight as elevator access is restricted to your own floor, 1st (for the gym), ground floor and basement.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the overall quality of rooms, facilities and service marvellous.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We will definitely return when in Cape Town again.
reviews.title: Would go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are loyal O&O clients, and so there was no question on where we would stay at Capetown. We stayed for 6 nights at an Island Room. However, the experience overall was disappointing and it is by far our least favorite O&O resort. The hotel markets itself as a 'resort hotel in the city". However, it felt more like a big, busy city hotel than a resort. It lacks character. Our biggest issue was service. Service was impersonal, inconsistent and not up to other O&O’s high standards.
reviews.title: Not up to par with other One and Only Resorts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though management was 'visible' in the physical sense, they rarely interacted with guests or tried to personalize the experience for us. Which is extremely unlike O&O culture. The Resort Manager seemed more of a desk clerk running a bank. You could sense there is some sort of a disconnect between management and the rest of the staff across the resort.
reviews.title: Great location and wonderful breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Island Rooms are very nice and spacious. Service everywhere was a hit or miss. Housekeeping was never consistent. Service at breakfast was inconsistent.
reviews.title: What a stunning hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool had the worst service of all. We usually would be out all day and arrive at the resort around 4 pm to hang out by the pool. By then, the pool attendants were never visible (we always had to seat ourselves, get our own towels, and look for someone to order from). The pool staff looked exhausted. And then every day at around 5:15 pm, the pool attendants would start cleaning up the pool area. Removing mattresses and stacking them up on top of each other, moving the pool chairs around. The LAST thing you need as you are relaxing around the resort's pool area is people cleaning up and moving furniture around you. It seemed like they were just dying to pack up and go home. The sun sets at 8 pm... to start packing up at 5 pm seems strange especially that there are hotel guests all around the pool still. However the food at the pool at Isola was fantastic.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful spot

reviews.text: I thought I had to "ckeck out" this much talked about hotel built by Sol Kerzners group and to establish whether all the "hype" around this hotel is substantiated.
reviews.title: Great Island Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel with Fantastic facilities...albeit for a price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the view from the rooms balcony onto the canal with apartments on the opposite side was not that fantastic. If you want a room with a view you need to book into the rooms situated above the main hotel.
reviews.title: Dinner @ One&Only - Reubens - not up to standard

reviews.text: When sitting on the balcony enjoying a cup of awesome coffee from their nespresso machine, you look into these apartments and the word voyeurism comes to mind.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The island rooms are very large and spacious. The large bed extremely comfortable with its percale linnens, firm mattress and ample pillows. The light switches are easily controllable from the bed. When you have the aircon running and open the sliding doors onto the balcony, the aircon switches off. A great feature.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a great location

description: One&Only Cape Town, one of the finest resorts in South Africa. This urban chic resort brings an unprecedented level of luxury to Cape Town, one of the world's most fascinating cities.With captivating views of Table Mountain from its enviable location in the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront, the resort is a destination unto itself. Discerning travellers are invited to discover the celebrated cuisines of Nobuyuki “Nobu” Matsuhisa and Reuben Riffel, socialise in the high-energy vibe of Vista Bar & Lounge and sample rare and undiscovered vintages at the stunning Wine Loft. The sublime calm of the city's most expansive and sophisticated spa offers an indulgent escape, while NEO Boutique debuts an enviable collection of designer fashions, some available for the first time in South Africa.As the first luxury hotel to open in Cape Town in nearly a decade, the resort is designed to celebrate the city's wine, art, design and spirit, balancing contemporary glamour with an authentic South African style.
